Description: Dome-shaped weight carved from grey hard stone, likely basalt; carinated sub-domed type; of truncated conical shape with flat base, sides sloping out to top and very slightly convex top, almost flat; slightly concave underside; smoothed surface; circular depression on top; possibly reused as hammer/grinder.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Oriental Institute, University of Chicago. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (VA.302)
